title: Gouging Prices
text:
Seems every time I go to book a ride prices that are normally $$6-$15 end up costing upwards of $35 to go 3 miles
Have to play games and wait 20-15 mins then see how much the fare has dropped
In my opinion that’s called “Bait and Switch “

title: Dirty Cars
text: If there is a way to give feedback to Uber about their service in general without blaming specific drivers, I can't find it. There's no use submitting dozens of complaints, it's simple: Uber clearly does not have its drivers submit images of their cars to prove cleanliness like a rental car app would, it's not hard. With all the surveillance, they could do that. Uber could encourage drivers to roll down the windows between rides or otherwise air out their breath and body odor before a new person gets in. Simple things that are not being done, and we're all paying way too much for these 1980s standards. I've literally gotten sick from sick drivers working while sick and sneezing while unmasked. I don't care if it's "just a cold" that is unprofessional. So disgusting. I'll add that Uber has ruined my plans and appointments by allowing drivers to cancel when they are finally just 2 minutes away after waiting for over 10. For now we have two options, Uber and Lyft. Seems they are both taking advantage of that.

title: Great ride from Charles
text: Charles was prompt and courteous. He took my shorter directions to my house I’ve the GPS ones, and he helped me with my baggage. I tipped him in cash at the end.

title: Fees charges
text: I am disappointed with the hidden fees that appear on the receipt I will find another means of transportation if I ever get a bogus fee again The fee was for tolls or traffic. There were no tolls and no traffic at all

title: Loved the reservation

userName: trying to work and live normal
title: I don’t support slavery rideshare business model
text: Lyft and Uber seazed the taxi and rideshare market for themselves, while their drivers struggling to get the minimum wage.Uber charge us( Riders) about $1  a minute and more so its about $60 an hour, but they give our drivers (who take care of our rides, safety and service us as queens and kings ) less than $20 an houre. So I decided to not pay lyft and after I order the trip and get the driver close to me I cancel the trip with lyft and pay directly the driver who accept always my offere of 5% 10% and 20% less than of Uber prices. Uber needs to respect drivers to guarantee our safety not getting into very ungry drivers’ cars who is really treated badly by Uber.
